## **3\. User Journey Map (High-Level UI Flow)**

\<\!-- AI INSTRUCTION: Create a Mermaid JS flowchart TD or stateDiagram-v2 illustrating the main navigational flow between screens. Show how a user moves from Login \-\> Dashboard \-\> Core Feature Screens. \--\>

flowchart TD  
    %% Basic UI Flow Example (Replace based on business flow)  
    Login\[Login Screen\] \--\> Dashboard\[Main Dashboard\]  
      
    Dashboard \--\>|Click 'New'| CreateModal\[Create Item Modal\]  
    CreateModal \--\>|Submit| Dashboard  
      
    Dashboard \--\>|Click Item| DetailView\[Item Detail View\]  
    DetailView \--\>|Click 'Edit'| EditView\[Edit Screen\]  
    EditView \--\>|Save| DetailView  
    DetailView \--\>|Back| Dashboard

## **5\. Global Navigation Strategy**

\<\!-- AI INSTRUCTION: Define how the user navigates globally across the app. \--\>

* **Primary Navigation:** \[e.g., Persistent Left Sidebar on Desktop, Bottom Tab Bar on Mobile.\]  
* **Secondary Navigation:** \[e.g., Breadcrumbs at the top of the Main Content area (e.g., Home \> Projects \> Project A).\]  
* **Contextual Actions:** \[e.g., Floating Action Button (FAB) on mobile for creating new items.\]
